1925 was probably the peak of prosperity and good times.

There was this great frenzy in this so-called last frontier, and they were overturning the sod at a frenzied pace.

This great flatland, this area that had been disparaged as the great American desert, was suddenly the wheat equivalent of a gold rush.

What was this great American desert?
It was arguably the world's greatest grassland.
This is the second biggest ecosystem in North America, and the southern part of the Great Plains nurtured the southern half of the American bison herd, perhaps up to 30 million bison.
